Comments_List: I really understood the underlying principles of environmental law from different legal perspective and jurisdictions and how the concept of environmental law can be leveraged to save the planet from environmental pollution. I learnt a lot about historical perspectives of the global environmental movement and the role environmental law has played in promoting the global environmental protection agenda.
Developed a framework for comparative environmental law everywhere and the resources to understand it.
Excellent course to learn about environmental laws in different countries
Knowledge, skills and insights gained in this class aligned very well with my expectations.
It aligned decently well; wish there'd been more in depth knowledge on some cases.

There were a lot of information to absorb but very little time. They two professors were great and knew their fields very well--and were therefore able to make the courses very practical and engaging. They provided a lot of real life case studies which made the course very interesting and practical.
Strengths was breadth of the course; the weakness was a lack of depth on each day.  I felt the civil law section was a bit weak.
Professors Robinson and Lye are very knowledgable
I will highly recommended this course to students with no background in law but interested in environmental law to take this course.
